solution_line_template: She has ${money_left_after_initial_supplies} left after buying initial supplies because {initial_money} - {mold_cost} -{stick_pack_cost} = <<{initial_money}-{mold_cost}-{stick_pack_cost}={money_left_after_initial_supplies}>>{money_left_after_initial_supplies}.

She can buy {num_juice_bottles} bottles of juice because {money_left_after_initial_supplies} / {juice_bottle_cost} = <<{money_left_after_initial_supplies}/{juice_bottle_cost}={num_juice_bottles}>>{num_juice_bottles}.
She can make {total_popsicles_made} popsicles because {popsicles_per_bottle} x {num_juice_bottles} = <<{popsicles_per_bottle}*{num_juice_bottles}={total_popsicles_made}>>{total_popsicles_made}
